but mount -l only shows one of them
whereas gparted shows both as mounted
thing is i made a backup of my root partition before i moved it
are you sure you have both mounted at root?  What's the output of sudo fdisk -l  ?
fdisk -l shows all partitions but doesn't show where they're mounted at
right, how about the output of mount?
mount -l only shows sdb5 as mounted and doesn't show sda5 at all
well, then it's highly likely that you only have sdb5 mounted, so I don't think you do have 2 mounted at /
ok, how do i fix that
fix what?  I'm not sure what the issue is?
Ah, ok, I think what you need to do is edit your fstab file.
well, normally at least, but since this is root, you may also need to change GRUB... hmm
fstab shows the UUID of sda5 for /
hmm, that's interesting, do you get an error for that mount failing in a log then?  Maybe that's too early in the boot process though.
hmm, yeah, them having the same UUID could be a problem, the chances of 2 UUIDs being the same though is extremely slim
lol, hmm, yeah, that seems like a good route to try.
